content:
Below please find the block vote on various DocumentReference gForge trackers prepared by John Moehrke. Since this is the first post-ownership-shift block vote for DocumentReference, this e-mail is shared across OO, StrucDoc, FHIR-I, and IHE. The block vote will occur during the Thursday, October 10, 1-2 ET OO conference call. Any pulled items would primarily be discussed during the OO on FHIR calls on Tuesday-s 2-3pm ET, unless the main call is needed to resolve any remaining issues.
Please let John know if you want to pull any of these items for discussion. Moving forward, as John will be facilitating the DocumentReference related gForges, these e-mails will come from him.
Thank you!
Balloters
Danielle Friend
Elliot Silver
John Moehrke
Jose Costa Teixeira
Keith Boone
Michelle Miller
Morten Ernebjerg
Nick Radov
Shamil Nizamov
Line Items
GF#14532 Add+media+thumbnails+%28or+similar%29 (Jose Costa Teixeira) Not Persuasive
GF#20323 DocumentReference+to+XDS+mapping+%28DocumentEntry.comments%2C+DocumentEntry.title%29 (Shamil Nizamov) Not Persuasive
GF#20346 Redefine+and+rename+context.event+to+%22keyword%22 (Elliot Silver) Not Persuasive
GF#22502 Add+intendedRecipient (Keith Boone) Not Persuasive
GF#17655 DocumentReference.relatesTo+should+not+be+marked+as+a+modifier (John Moehrke) Persuasive
GF#19823 DocumentReference+needs+query+parameter+for+content.attachment.creation (John Moehrke) Persuasive
GF#19860 Add+docStatus+search+parameter+to+DocumentReference+Resource (Danielle Friend) Persuasive
GF#20351 Remove+EpisodeOfCare+from+DocumentReference.context.encounter (Elliot Silver) Persuasive
GF#20353 Add+CareTeam+to+DocumentReference.author (Elliot Silver) Persuasive
GF#19482 DocumentReference+w5+mapping+for+type (Michelle Miller) Persuasive with Mod
GF#20020 Change+example+of+non-standard+document+format (Nick Radov) Persuasive with Mod
GF#20352 Additional+DocumentReference+subjects (Elliot Silver) Persuasive with Mod
GF#23732 Clarify+meaning+of+multiple+elements+in+DocumentReference.content (Morten Ernebjerg) Persuasive with Mod
@Keith Boone did you look at the resolution explanation for GF#22502 Add+intendedRecipient (Keith Boone) Not Persuasive

Yep, and it completely ignores the fact that some CDA documents (and therefore some content that could also show up in FHIR) is written for an intendedRecipient. See /ClinicalDocument/informationRecipient. It's not a function of transport, it's something that is completely relevant to the context of the information being communicated .
by that logic EVERY resource in FHIR should have that element. Yet everywhere there is a separation of object from communication or transport.
